snippet: The Fed says that 21.9 percent of banks surveyed last month said they eased credit for third-quarter commercial real estate loans, while 2.7 percent tightened them.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column on the upswing in the commercial real estate market; notes Fed data showing that 21.9 percent of banks surveyed say they eased credit for third-quarter commercial real estate loans, while only 2.7 percent tightened them.
lead_paragraph: The Fed says that 21.9 percent of banks surveyed last month said they eased credit for third-quarter commercial real estate loans, while 2.7 percent tightened them.

headline.print_headline: The Market for Office Properties Is Heating Up
headline.main: Market for Office Properties Is Heating Up
